body.p: The IASB considered that continuing to apply the Phase 1 amendments after the uncertainty arising from the reform is no longer present would not faithfully represent the actual characteristics of the elements of the hedging relationship in which the uncertainty has been eliminated nor the economic effects of the reform. The IASB therefore added paragraph 6.8.13 to IFRS 9 so the Phase 1 exception from the separately identifiable requirement ceases to apply at the earlier of:

li.p: when changes required by the reform are made to the non-contractually specified risk component as set out in paragraph 6.9.1 of IFRS 9; or
when the hedging relationship in which the non-contractually specified risk component was designated is discontinued.
